headline.print_headline: Where Chocolate Lovers Can Play Willy Wonka
headline.seo: Chocolate Classes for Families on the Lower East Side
headline.main: Where Chocolate Lovers Can Play Willy Wonka

docs.snippet: A Manhattan mother and her daughter share their passion for high-quality chocolate by making their own treats with the chocolatier Aditi Malhotra at Christian Vautier Le Concept on the Lower East Side....

keywords.value: Christian Vautier Le Concept (Manhattan, NY, Restaurant)
keywords.name: organizations

docs.abstract: Christian Vautier Le Concept, a French confection shop on the Lower East Side of Manhattan, offers private and small-group chocolate-making classes for adults with children.
docs.lead_paragraph: A Manhattan mother and her daughter share their passion for high-quality chocolate by making their own treats with the chocolatier Aditi Malhotra at Christian Vautier Le Concept on the Lower East Side.

docs.snippet: Heather Hammond, who runs the Heliummm Aerial Dance and Entertainment company, teaches classes on aerial dance for various skill levels at gyms in Manhattan and Brooklyn....
docs.abstract: Urban Athlete column; Hype Gym in the Kips Bay neighborhood of Manhattan offers aerial dance classes, where participants suspended on silks several feet above the ground can get both a workout and a new creative outlet.
docs.lead_paragraph: Heather Hammond, who runs the Heliummm Aerial Dance and Entertainment company, teaches classes on aerial dance for various skill levels at gyms in Manhattan and Brooklyn.

headline.print_headline: The Dual Powers of Woman, in Muted Force or Frenzied Abandon
headline.seo: ‘Dido and Aeneas,’ From Mark Morris, at Mostly Mozart
headline.main: The Dual Powers of Woman, in Muted Force or Frenzied Abandon

docs.snippet: A single woman dances both Dido and the Sorceress in the Mostly Mozart revival of Mark Morris’s version of “Dido and Aeneas.”...
docs.abstract: Alastair Macaulay reviews choreographer Mark Morris's interpretation of Purcell opera Dido and Aeneas, with the title roles danced by Amber Star Merkens, at the Rose Theater at Lincoln Center; performance is part of the Mostly Mozart Festival.
docs.lead_paragraph: A single woman dances both Dido and the Sorceress in the Mostly Mozart revival of Mark Morris’s version of “Dido and Aeneas.”

headline.seo: Mahogany’s History in Slavery in the Caribbean

docs.snippet: The historian Jennifer L. Anderson’s “Mahogany: The Costs of Luxury in Early America” explores the origins of some 18th-century furniture....
docs.abstract: Eve M Kahn Antiques column; book Mahogany: The Costs of Luxury in Early America by historian Jennifer L Anderson details the appalling conditions under which slaves harvested mahogany across the Caribbean for 18th-century furniture, revealing the human dramas behind the objects; architectural historian Caroline Rob Zaleski book Long Island Modernism 1930-1980 documents 500 structures, mostly mid-island properties designed by internationally known figures; many have been destroyed or changed beyond recognition.
docs.lead_paragraph: The historian Jennifer L. Anderson’s “Mahogany: The Costs of Luxury in Early America” explores the origins of some 18th-century furniture.
